intro: Synotis panzhouensis, commonly known as the Panzhou synotis, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous regions, preferring cool and moist environments. Its leaves are lanceolate and often covered in a fine pubescence. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
